Get ready for over three hours of gangster goodness.

Goodfellas director Martin Scorsese has returned to the crime drama genre with his epic new film The Irishman, which reunites him with old playmates in stars Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci.

The film is an epic saga of organised crime in post-war America told through the eyes veteran Frank Sheeran (De Niro), who worked alongside and for some of the most notorious figures of the 20th century.

Spanning decades,The Irishman chronicles one of the greatest unsolved mysteries in American history, the disappearance of legendary union boss Jimmy Hoffa (played by the legendary Al Pacino ), and offers a monumental journey through sin, regret, betrayals, and mortality,

It has already received rave reviews from critics , including in our verdict , but when is it out on UK Netflix ?

When is The Irishman released on Netflix?

(Image: Netflix)

The Irishman is released on Netflix worldwide on November 27, 2019.

This is weeks after its limited release in UK cinemas on November 8, 2019.

Martin Scorsese recently spoke out on the importance of movie theatres needing to keep traditional narrative cinema alive.

At a press conference for the BFI London Film Festival he said: "That's a big issue and we need the theatre owners to step up for that and to allow theatres to show films that are narrative films, and narrative film can be one long take for three hours, two now.

"It doesn't have to be a conventional beginning, middle, and end."

Do you agree with Martin Scorsese?

The Irishman is in UK cinemas on November 8, 2019, before its Netflix release on November 27, 2019.
